channel.title: CVE Feed for Silicon Labs -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Silicon Labs -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-51395|2024-09-25T16:03:46.409Z -- silicon%20labs -- z-wave%20sdk
item.description: The vulnerability described by CVE-2023-0972 has been additionally discovered in Silicon Labs Z-Wave end devices. This vulnerability may allow an unauthenticated attacker within Z-Wave range to overflow a stack buffer, leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-0972|2024-09-25T15:41:17.919Z -- silicon%20labs -- z%2Fip%20gateway
item.description: Description: A vulnerability in SiLabs Z/IP Gateway 7.18.01 and earlier allows an unauthenticated attacker within Z-Wave range to overflow a stack buffer, leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-4041|2024-09-25T16:19:31.647Z -- silicon%20labs -- gecko%20bootloader
item.description: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow'), Out-of-bounds Write, Download of Code Without Integrity Check vulnerability in Silicon Labs Gecko Bootloader on ARM (Firmware Update File Parser modules) allows Code Injection, Authentication Bypass.This issue affects "Standalone" and "Application" versions of Gecko Bootloader.

item.title: CVE-2023-0970|2024-09-25T15:35:20.463Z -- silicon%20labs -- z%2Fip%20gateway
item.description: Multiple buffer overflow vulnerabilities in SiLabs Z/IP Gateway SDK version 7.18.01 and earlier allow an attacker with invasive physical access to a Z-Wave controller device to overwrite global memory and potentially execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2023-3110|2024-09-25T15:46:07.954Z -- silicon%20labs -- unify%20gateway
item.description: Description: A vulnerability in SiLabs Unify Gateway 1.3.1 and earlier allows an unauthenticated attacker within Z-Wave range to overflow a stack buffer, leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-0969|2024-09-25T15:29:54.520Z -- silicon%20labs -- z%2Fip%20gateway
item.description: A vulnerability in SiLabs Z/IP Gateway 7.18.01 and earlier allows an authenticated attacker within Z-Wave range to manipulate an array pointer to disclose the contents of global memory.

item.title: CVE-2023-41093|2024-08-02T18:46:11.834Z -- silicon%20labs -- simplicity%20sdk
item.description: Use After Free vulnerability in Silicon Labs Bluetooth SDK on 32 bit, ARM may allow an attacker with precise timing capabilities to intercept a small number of packets intended for a recipient that has left the network.This issue affects Silabs Bluetooth SDK: through 8.0.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-22472|2024-08-01T22:51:09.827Z -- silicon%20labs -- z-wave%20sdk
item.description:
A buffer Overflow vulnerability in Silicon Labs 500 Series Z-Wave devices may allow Denial of Service, and potential Remote Code execution
This issue affects all versions of Silicon Labs 500 Series SDK prior to v6.85.2
running on Silicon Labs 500 series Z-wave devices.

item.title: CVE-2023-41093|2024-07-30T18:49:50.246Z -- silicon%20labs -- simplicity%20sdk
item.description: Use After Free vulnerability in Silicon Labs Bluetooth SDK on 32 bit, ARM may allow an attacker with precise timing capabilities to intercept a small number of packets intended for a recipient that has left the network.This issue affects Silabs Bluetooth SDK: through 8.0.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-22472|2024-06-04T17:52:56.713Z -- silicon%20labs -- z-wave%20sdk
item.description:
A buffer Overflow vulnerability in Silicon Labs 500 Series Z-Wave devices may allow Denial of Service, and potential Remote Code execution
This issue affects all versions of Silicon Labs 500 Series SDK prior to v6.85.2
running on Silicon Labs 500 series Z-wave devices.

item.title: CVE-2023-41093|2024-07-12T19:56:16.225Z -- silicon%20labs -- simplicity%20sdk
item.description: Use After Free vulnerability in Silicon Labs Bluetooth SDK on 32 bit, ARM may allow an attacker with precise timing capabilities to intercept a small number of packets intended for a recipient that has left the network.This issue affects Silabs Bluetooth SDK: through 8.0.0.
